snippet: Dr. Corson, a nuclear physicist, was Cornell’s provost during the 1960s, when students demanded a black studies program, and its president during the 1970s, when students protested the Vietnam War.
abstract: Dale R Corson, nuclear physicist and Cornell University official who helped quell a potentially explosive student protest in 1969, dies at age 97.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Corson, a nuclear physicist, was Cornell’s provost during the 1960s, when students demanded a black studies program, and its president during the 1970s, when students protested the Vietnam War.

headline.seo: Dale Corson, Cornell Administrator Who Helped Quell Protest, Dies at 97
headline.main: Dale Corson, Cornell Administrator Who Helped Quell Protest, Dies at 97
headline.print_headline: Dale Corson, 97, Cornell Official Who Helped Quell Protest in ’69
